intro: Epacris impressa var. rosea, commonly known as the pink fairy moth or the pink epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a member of the heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular pink or rose-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in rocky or sandy soils in heathlands and open forests. It produces showy inflorescences that attract nectar-feeding insects and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. The species is also popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
